DataElement.preferredName: Screening Mammogram Scheduled Or Intent Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Verification at a particular time that a screening mammogram is scheduled, or anticipated, as outlined in the study protocol, in order to allow a patient to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Screening Mammogram Scheduled Or Intent Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A systematic examination or assessment._A low voltage X-ray photograph of the breast generally done to detect breast cancer. This method is also valuable in diagnosis of benign abnormal conditions of the breast such as fibroadenoma, mastitis, abscess, and cysts._To order a planned list of activities or events._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._Having been established or verified._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A systematic examination or assessment.:A low voltage X-ray photograph of the breast generally done to detect breast cancer. This method is also valuable in diagnosis of benign abnormal conditions of the breast such as fibroadenoma, mastitis, abscess, and cysts.

Concepts.definition: A low voltage X-ray photograph of the breast generally done to detect breast cancer. This method is also valuable in diagnosis of benign abnormal conditions of the breast such as fibroadenoma, mastitis, abscess, and cysts.

Property.preferredName: Scheduled Or Intent Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria

Concepts.definition: To order a planned list of activities or events.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
